page.title: 15HIGHLAND FOLK MUSEUM (1)
page.content:
The museum stands on a six acre site on the north east edge of Kingussie. It is the{Regional Museum}of country life and has collections relating to social economic history of the entire Highland Region and Western Isles.
Within the grounds there is a specialist farming museum and an open air museum with a{Blackhouse}from the Isle of Lewis, a salmon smoke house and a turf walled house from the Central Highlands.
There is a permanent staff of seven with employment for up to twenty local people in the main summer season. {Forty thousand tourists}visit each year adding greatly to the tourism base on which the local area so greatly depends.
